result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John J. Thoms

defendant.name: Thoms, John J.
defendant.address: 2779 Maang Avenue PO Box 471, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs, no contact whatsoever with DC (1987), can have mother make arrangements to get children - but he can not have contact with DC, curfew 7 days a week 6:00 pm until 7:00 am, living at 206 Makwa Trail, Lac du Flambeau

2:30 PM Defendant John J. Thoms in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett appeared by video for John J. Thoms.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights complied with. No victim appearing. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court. State speaks to the defendant making contact with the victim even though conditions state not too. Defense does not object to court order. Court makes order effective immediately to NOT have contact with DC (1987). Defense requests bond modification. State brings up question of where defendant would be residing.  Court orders: $1,000 signature bond with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs, no contact whatsoever with DC (1987), can have mother make arrangements to get children - but he can not have contact with DC, curfew 7 days a week 7:00 pm until 7:00 am, living at 206 Makwa Trail, Lac du Flambeau. Amended bond form.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:13 AM Defendant John J. Thoms in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian F. Bennett appeared by video for John J. Thoms.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Defense states they did not receive criminal complaint, however wishes to move forward.  Defense stands mute on charges.  Motion to modify bond to be heard at preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:13 PM Defendant John J. Thoms appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has tried reaching out to his attorney Mr Bennett who he has in other cases. Defendant requests a bond modification. Court advises he needs to send a request to court. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs. No victim with DC (1987), not to be on premises of 2779 Maang Ave in Lac du Flambeau unless accompanied by law enforcement.

1:30 PM Defendant John J. Thoms appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights complied with. Defendant confirms receipt of complaint. Charges read. Attorney rights given. Defendant will be getting a public defender. State speaks to bond. Court orders $500.00 CASH with conditions of: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs. No victim with DC (1987), not to be on premises of 2779 Maang Ave in Lac du Flambeau unless accompanied by law enforcement. Bond form.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
